text: [Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm vges A Cloud support engineer
here at the AWS office in Sydney today
I'm going to show you how to configure
text records that are longer than 255
characters in Amazon Route 53 let's get
started after logging into the AWS
Management console navigate to the r 53
console in the navigation page choose
hosted zones open the hosted zone for
the domain where you want to configure
the SPF record paste the SPF record
value provided by your email service
provider in a text document the value of
a text record contains one or more
strings that are enclosed within double
quotation marks and each string can
contain up to 255
characters in The Following SPF record
value because there are more than 255
characters I will get an error if I try
to use it directly to create a text
record you must break the values with
more than 255 characters into individual
strings that are fewer than 255
characters then you must enclose them in
double quotation marks please note that
every row is considered as an individual
text value and when you have more than
one text value to be inputed please
enter one value per row similarly when
you have only one text value it has to
be entered within a single row copy the
value for the SPF record and then paste
it under the value section choose text
from the drop- down menu for record type
specify the TTL value that you want or
leave it as the default value of 300
leave the routing policy as simple
routing and then choose create
record after you configure the
appropriate text record use dig or NS
lookup to validate if you can retrieve
the intended text record value so now
you know how to configure text records
that are longer than 255 characters in
Route
53 thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Applause]
[Music]
